Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Cup
Description: This relatively flared cup has a flat ring base. The lip, which is a continuation of the body, is slightly inverted and thinned. Throwing marks are still quite visible on the exterior of the cup, a surface that has also been covered with a white glaze. An orange stripe runs around the top rim and a few drops of that same colours appear inside, at the bottom of the vessel.
